results.title: Olivia Newton-John, Pop Singer and ‘Grease’ Star, Dies at 73
results.abstract: She amassed No. 1 hits, chart-topping albums and four records that sold more than two million copies each. More than anything else, she was likable, even beloved.

media.caption: Olivia Newton-John starring as Sandy in the 1978 hit movie “Grease.” She was a four-time Grammy winner, beguiling listeners with a high, supple, vibrato-warmed voice.

results.title: How do you manage Omicron BA.5 symptoms, including a sore throat?
results.abstract: The longtime symptom of Covid is becoming more common, and sometimes more severe, with the dominant BA.5 subvariant.

results.title: If Trump broke a law on the removal of official records, would he be barred from future office?
results.abstract: An obscure criminal law bars the removal of official records, on penalty of disqualification from holding any federal office. But it may not play out that way.

media.caption: Boxes were moved out of the Eisenhower Executive Office building inside the White House complex near the end of President Donald J. Trump’s term.

results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: Albuquerque Police Detain Suspect in Killings of Muslim Men
results.abstract: The shootings of four Muslim men since November may be connected, the police have said, raising fears in a place where many immigrants and refugees had felt at home.

media.caption: Concern has grown at the Islamic Center of New Mexico since the killings started.

results.title: The search appears to signal a major escalation in the various investigations into the Trump presidency.

results.title: Prosecutors Pursue Inquiry Into Trump’s Handling of Classified Material
results.abstract: A federal grand jury has issued at least one subpoena, and investigators are seeking interviews in the case of sensitive documents that ended up at the former president’s Florida home.

media.caption: After his term ended, former President Donald J. Trump took 15 boxes from the White House to his home at Mar-a-Lago. They were later returned, but some items in them were found to be classified.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.title: A Big TV Hit Is a Conservative Fantasy Liberals Should Watch
results.abstract: America is as divided over its favorite prestige television shows as news sources.

media.caption: Kevin Costner as John Dutton III in “Yellowstone.”

results.title: Kill Your Lawn, Before It Kills You
results.abstract: Lawns are bad for you, your pets and the planet. It’s time to move on to greener pastures.

results.abstract: The former president’s legal team has vowed to fight the congressional effort “tooth and nail.” He is virtually certain to appeal to the Supreme Court.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump speaking at the Conservative Political Action Conference in Dallas on Saturday. His legal team has vowed to fight the effort to gain access to his tax records, and he is virtually certain to appeal to the Supreme Court.

results.title: David McCullough, Best-Selling Explorer of America’s Past, Dies at 89
results.abstract: His research — on Adams, Truman and so much more — was deep, his writing was lively, and his narrator’s voice in documentary films was familiar to millions.

media.caption: The author David McCullough in 2001, the year his biography “John Adams” was published. It would go on to win a Pulitzer Prize, his second.

results.title: F.B.I. Search of Trump’s Home Pushes Long Conflict Into Public View
results.abstract: Justice Department officials were worried that the former president had not fully complied with requests to return material taken from the White House that included possible classified information.

media.caption: F.B.I. agents reportedly searched former President Donald J. Trump’s residence and office, as a well as a storage unit, at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Fla.

results.byline: By Elaine Louie and Elizabeth Paton
results.title: Issey Miyake, Who Opened a Door for Japanese Fashion, Dies at 84
results.abstract: The first Japanese designer to show in Paris, he was known for his origami-like designs, creating pleated skirts, dresses and trousers that afforded freedom.

media.caption: Issey Miyake in 1991 after presenting his collection in Paris. “I don’t make fashion. I make clothes,” he once said.

results.title: The Country That Wants to ‘Be Average’ vs. Jeff Bezos and His $500 Million Yacht
results.abstract: Why did Rotterdam stand between one of the world’s richest men and his boat? The furious response is rooted in Dutch values.

media.caption: The Hef Bridge, in Rotterdam, Netherlands, was decommissioned as a railroad bridge in the early 1990s. A request to briefly dismantle the middle span was withdrawn in the face of protests.

results.title: Trump Asked Aide Why His Generals Couldn’t Be Like Hitler’s, Book Says
results.abstract: The former president once asked his chief of staff why his military leadership couldn’t be more like the German generals who had reported to Adolf Hitler, according to an excerpt.

media.caption: Gen. Mark A. Milley, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under President Donald J. Trump, once drafted a resignation letter accusing the president of embracing the tyranny, dictatorship and extremism that the military had sworn to fight.
